user.title: iPhone Alarms Sync
user.description:
Choose how you want to add alarm synchronization for your iPhone/iPad:

**Option 1: Select from Mobile App devices** (Recommended)
- Creates a visible relationship with your Mobile App device in Home Assistant
- Alarm synchronization device will appear as connected to the Mobile App device
- Automatically generates device name from Mobile App device name (e.g., "Kuba iPhone" becomes "Kuba iPhone Alarms")
- Recommended for better device identification and organization
- Use this if you have the Home Assistant mobile app installed

**Option 2: Enter custom device name**
- No relationship with Mobile App device
- You manually enter the device name (no "Alarms" suffix will be added)
- Device will be independent in device registry
- Use this if you don't have Mobile App integration or want a standalone device

**Device Name** is a friendly name for alarm synchronization. This name generates a **Phone ID** that you'll need for iOS shortcuts setup.

select_mobile_app.title: Select Mobile App Device
select_mobile_app.description:
Select a device from your Mobile App integration.

This option is recommended for better device identification and organization. It will create a visible relationship between the alarm synchronization device and the selected Mobile App device. The alarm synchronization device will appear as connected to the Mobile App device in Home Assistant's device registry.

The device name will be automatically generated from the Mobile App device name with " Alarms" suffix (e.g., "Kuba iPhone" becomes "Kuba iPhone Alarms"). This name will be used to generate a **Phone ID** that you'll need for iOS shortcuts setup.

custom_name.title: Enter Device Name
custom_name.description:
Enter a name for alarm synchronization of your iPhone/iPad device.

This option does not create a relationship with any Mobile App device. The alarm synchronization device will be independent in Home Assistant's device registry.

Note: The name you enter will be used as-is (no "Alarms" suffix will be added). This name will be used to generate a **Phone ID** (e.g., "Kuba iPhone" becomes "kuba_iphone"). You'll need this Phone ID when setting up the iOS shortcut.

confirm.title: Confirm Device Setup
confirm.description:
**Alarm Synchronization Device Name:** {phone_name}
**Phone ID:** `{phone_id}`

‚ö†Ô∏è **Important:** Save this Phone ID! You'll need it when setting up the iOS shortcuts.

The Phone ID is generated from the device name and is used to identify your device when syncing alarms.

Alarms will be automatically synchronized when you run the sync shortcut for the first time.

üí° **Tip:** You can also create event shortcuts to track when alarms go off, are snoozed, or stopped. Additionally, you can track Sleep events (Bedtime starts, Waking Up, Wind Down starts) by creating shortcuts that call the respective services. After setup, go to the device configuration to find detailed instructions and all alarm IDs.

‚ö†Ô∏è **Warning:** If you disable the option to sync disabled alarms, alarm entities will disappear from Home Assistant when you disable them on your iPhone. Entities will reappear when you enable the alarm again.

Edit your alarm synchronization device settings.

‚ö†Ô∏è **Note:** Changing the device name will generate a new Phone ID. Make sure to update your iOS shortcut with the new Phone ID if you change the name.

sync_shortcut.title: Sync Shortcut Setup
sync_shortcut.description:
**Alarm Synchronization Device:** {phone_name}
**Phone ID:** `{phone_id}`

‚ö†Ô∏è **Important:** Copy this Phone ID - you'll need it when setting up the shortcut on your iPhone/iPad.

The service `iphone_alarms_sync.sync_alarms` is available. Create a shortcut that calls this service with:
- `phone_id`: `{phone_id}`
- `alarms`: Array of alarm objects

Alarms will be automatically synchronized when you run the shortcut for the first time.

event_shortcuts.title: Event Shortcuts Setup
event_shortcuts.description:
**Phone ID:** `{phone_id}`

**Available Services for Alarm Events:**

1. **`iphone_alarms_sync.report_alarm_event`** - For specific alarms
   - Requires: `phone_id`, `alarm_id` (UUID), `event`
   - The UUID will be automatically extracted from formats like "x-apple-clock:alarm?id=UUID" or "x-apple-clock://alarm/UUID"

2. **`iphone_alarms_sync.report_wakeup_event`** - For Apple's native Wake-Up alarm
   - Requires: `phone_id`, `event`
   - No `alarm_id` needed - automatically handles Wake-Up alarm

3. **`iphone_alarms_sync.report_any_event`** - For any alarm
   - Requires: `phone_id`, `event`
   - No `alarm_id` needed - works for any alarm that triggers the shortcut

**Available Services for Sleep Events:**

4. **`iphone_alarms_sync.report_bedtime_event`** - When Bedtime starts
   - Requires: `phone_id` only
   - Sensor entity will appear automatically after the first event

5. **`iphone_alarms_sync.report_waking_up_event`** - When Waking Up occurs
   - Requires: `phone_id` only
   - Sensor entity will appear automatically after the first event

6. **`iphone_alarms_sync.report_wind_down_event`** - When Wind Down starts
   - Requires: `phone_id` only
   - Sensor entity will appear automatically after the first event

**Synchronized Alarms:**
{alarms_list}

**Alarm Event Types:**
- `goes_off` - Alarm started ringing
- `snoozed` - Alarm was snoozed
- `stopped` - Alarm was stopped/dismissed

**Instructions for Alarm Events:**
1. Create a new Shortcut on your iPhone/iPad
2. Add "Call Home Assistant Service" action
3. Select one of the alarm event services above
4. Set `phone_id`: `{phone_id}`
5. For `report_alarm_event`: Set `alarm_id` to the alarm UUID (shown above, can also use full format like "x-apple-clock:alarm?id=UUID" - UUID will be extracted automatically)
6. Set `event` to one of the event types above: `goes_off`, `snoozed`, or `stopped`
7. Create a Personal Automation to trigger this shortcut when an alarm event occurs

**Instructions for Sleep Events:**
1. Create a new Shortcut on your iPhone/iPad
2. Add "Call Home Assistant Service" action
3. Select one of the sleep event services: `report_bedtime_event`, `report_waking_up_event`, or `report_wind_down_event`
4. Set `phone_id`: `{phone_id}`
5. Create a Personal Automation to trigger this shortcut when the respective sleep event occurs (e.g., "When Bedtime starts", "When Waking Up", "When Wind Down starts")

üí° **Tip:** Use `report_wakeup_event` or `report_any_event` for simpler alarm setup - no need to specify alarm_id. For sleep events, use the dedicated services - they only require `phone_id`. The sensor entities for all events will appear automatically after the first event is reported.
